Current focus (this month): ABA clinic / HCBS (Phoenix Metro) — LOI signed; active risk review on about 96% Medicaid exposure. The state filed a motion to dismiss the Centria v. MercyCare case; seller is slow on billing reports and fee schedules. Pushkar will push a re-trade next week and set an end-of-January go/no-go; Wendy at Live Oak is back and will be briefed.

Healthcare IT installations + MSP (Greater LA; hospitals) — LOI fully signed. Met seller; business is highly owner dependent; seller willing to stay 3–5 years. Broker pushed a template APA and talked about exclusivity being non binding; using the 25 day window to get full financials and weekly seller calls. Lenders: Jared at First Internet asked for a full file; Tom Lyons at Byline is interested and quoted Prime plus about 2%.
Next up (queued): Off‑market ABA clinics in Greater Phoenix (top priority for outreach)
MSPs / IT managed services (secondary off‑market track)
Recently covered (last 2 months): AppClarity (B2B software) — went to another buyer; treating as closed out.
Commercial landscaping (Phoenix area; Benchmark) — passed; seller refuses SBA, will not sell to an AZ buyer, and wants far above ~$12M.
Hard NOs: Restaurants and food & beverage of all types (restaurants, cafes, bars, food trucks, grocery, liquor and wine)
Most retail stores and consumer shops (apparel, jewelry, furniture, gift, vape, convenience, office furniture, gun stores, etc.)
Discretionary entertainment and leisure venues (amusement parks, arcades, escape rooms, cinemas, go-karting, golf courses, nightclubs, theaters, sports teams or facilities)
Traditional media outlets dependent on ads or subscriptions (newspapers, periodicals or magazines, radio and television stations)
Crypto-related businesses and ad or affiliate content sites, dropshipping or FBA ecommerce, mobile apps-only plays
Algorithm‑dependent online businesses reliant on Google search or paid traffic
Consumer transportation rentals and taxis; RV dealers
Cash-heavy or reputationally sensitive categories (bail bonds, collection agencies, pawn, cash-for-gold)
Tree farms and orchards; garden centers and nurseries
Pure beauty salon concepts that are mainly cosmetic wants (hair or nail salons, esthetician retail-only)
Party and event venues or rentals, wedding venues, tanning salons, seminars-only businesses, KDP-only publishing
Businesses with heavy ongoing working capital needs (big AR/inventory swings, heavy line-of-credit usage)
New-construction-heavy contractors or project-only trades without strong maintenance/backlog
Open Pool (after NOs): Healthcare services and clinics that meet real needs, with recurring or sticky demand
Home health, ABA therapy, PT or OT or speech therapy, end-of-life services, dermatology, vein clinic, urology, optometry and optical services, audiology and hearing aids, weight loss, rehab
Med spa services with sticky retention such as injectables; LASIK or laser eye where appropriate
IT and managed services
Managed service providers, cybersecurity services, network consultants, help desk and endpoint management, cloud or infrastructure support
B2B services and professional services
Accounting and bookkeeping, tax, appraisal and valuation, insurance agencies, mortgage brokers, financial advisors, notary, credit card merchant services, business insurance
Digital agencies that serve businesses (SEO, web design or development, banner or screen printing, custom signs)
Building and construction trades with service or maintenance revenue

HVAC service and light install, plumbing, electrical and mechanical, elevator service, garage doors, roofing with inspections or maintenance plans, spray foam or insulation, lighting contractors, door and window install, glazing and glass, concrete and stamped concrete, tile and flooring services, kitchen or bath remodeling, general and specialty contractors
Facility and property services

Janitorial and office cleaning, window cleaning, gutter or chimney cleaning, pressure or oven cleaning, property maintenance, pest control, landscaping, commercial landscaping, pool service, security services, home automation and home security, mold remediation
Industrial and light manufacturing

Sign manufacturing and custom signage, metal fabrication and welding, machine shops, precision manufacturing, electronic components, lighting products, glass or stone or concrete products, rubber and plastics, paper and packaging, furniture manufacturing, lumber and wood products
Transportation and logistics services
Freight forwarders, courier services, moving and storage, towing, bus charter, logistics and last mile
Child and education services
Daycare and childcare centers, preschools, learning centers, tutoring and test prep, language schools and classes, specialized or career education, virtual or online learning
Pet services
Grooming, daycare and boarding, training, veterinarian services, pet supplies
Home and consumer services with steady need
Locksmiths, handyman services, painting, carpet cleaning and install, closet systems, blinds, home inspections, home security
Waste, storage, and other steady-need niches
Junk removal, waste removal and management, self storage, laundromats and dry cleaners, salvage yards
Communications and media that serve business needs
Banner printing, custom signage, selected internet publishers or ISPs where local moat exists
Select software or online models
Niche SaaS only if reasonably priced, sticky, and B2B focused; web development or digital product agencies that are services-led rather than ad-driven
